infoSections.text: An Arduino is a versatile microcontroller platform used in electronics development for prototyping, automation, and signal processing through easy-to-use hardware and software. In neurotech applications, it facilitates the development of brain-computer interface (BCI) prototypes, biosignal acquisition systems, and neural stimulation devices, enabling rapid testing and real-time data processing for innovative neuroelectronic solutions.

tasks.taskDescription: Download [Arduino] and then watch these videos to understand the user interface of the software. Watch the following video to understand the basic components of Arduino. This will give you a basic idea of the hardware you will be working with.
